Key Arguments: The government should not have the authority to determine what is true or false on social media.
The exemption of the government from the legislation suggests bias and fear of independent media.
The bill is perceived as a tool for propaganda and silencing dissenting voices.
The legislation is seen as an overreach that threatens freedom of speech and democratic values.
Notable Quotes: With all due respect, who are you to discern what is the truth and what is a lie on social media?
Legislating to silence the voices of those who oppose you shows an incredible sign of weakness in our elected government.
We live in Australia â€“ a free and supposedly democratic country. People are sick of government over-reach in their lives, and they will not be silenced.
